page.title: 20A PAGE IN VERNACULAR-EGMERE
page.content: If you use long 'a' sounds, oi for 'i', ew for 'u', w for 'v' and shorten words while speaking in slow, even tones you MAY have our Norfolk accent. "Oi'm ago-in ta pearnt yew a picksher o' this hare willudge.Farst thar's a awfu' lotta fields n' hedges what them buds sitta bowt in-churpun orl daay. Then agen yew'll foind a fare few trees whare yew moit notus a squirrul- go yew cearful loike.Them tha graay uns,oi tell yew theya narsty warmints. Then agen,we gotta bitta charch hare- thet got a bit tired a standun a gud owd toime ago.We got tha owd airfield what they med in the war.Thas a mill now what meark aanimal fud.Thar ent tew many pearple live hare now,oi reckon theya gorn orf tew live ut up in the broit loits. Moind oi say thas a bewtiful plearce-sartunly thet'll dew fer me,toime oi'm hare."
